subject: Badminton
lead_paragraph: The president of badminton’s world governing body yesterday lashed out at the group’s top council after it passed a vote of no confidence in him in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Kang Young Joong, the president of the Badminton World Federation, said the federation had become “mired in darkness.” The controversy revolves around the move of the federation’s headquarters to Kuala Lumpur from Cheltenham in England. The federation is investigating pledges of money and airline tickets that were reportedly made by Kang’s deputy, the former Malaysian shuttler Datuk Gunalan.
